main event: A military officer reported a sighting of metallic silver spherical objects, each 2-3 feet in diameter, traveling at tremendous speed and maneuvering against the wind in Ft. Richardson, Alaska on 17th September 1947.
interesting points: The report indicates that the objects were observed at an altitude of about 10,000 feet, with each object traveling against the wind at a tremendous speed for a duration of 15-20 seconds.
There were no distinct trails, apparent construction, or sound associated with the observed objects.
The objects were metallic silver in color and spherical in shape, and no odor was detected during the sighting.
The text also suggests that there were no photographs or sketches taken of the sighting, and the means of disappearance of the objects is unknown.
The report highlights the request for immediate action to mark the correspondence with the classification 'secret', indicating the sensitivity of the matter.
